text: I found the variety of the sashimi plate to be satisfying - fresh and yummy .
The wine selection ( by the glass and bottle ) is wonderful and I always recommend that friends make a reservation if they 're going to be in town .
Even better , they know how to cook French classics like Steak au Poivre and Onglet without burning it to death or overcooking it .
The location and ambience is Ok but the food is what makes up for it .
The menu is Prix Fixe , so be prepared to spend at least $ 60 per person , but it is Well worth itsuperb food .
There are much better places in NY with better prices .
The fish is fresh and each piece is sliced to perfection and seasoned by the sushi chef ( usually with a little fresh wasabi and soy sauce but also sometimes with some sea salt ) .
Kosher dills are the perfect compliment for your unforgetable sandwich and they give you plenty of them .
Yes , they use fancy ingredients , but even fancy ingredients do n't make for good pizza unless someone knows how to get the crust right .
Despite the fact that the space is large , they 've overcrowded the floor with tables .
If the omakase is to showcase technique and variety , serving almost 40 % of items BBQ-ed and a spicy tuna roll wrapped with not-so-fresh nori seems to be a rather limp performance .
The staff was too busy ordering sushi for dinner and then laying it out to eat on the bar to even bring me my check .
Yeah , sometimes the service can be slow .
I would never wait for a table to eat , it just is not THAT great .
I ordered the crab cocktail and it was soaked in a lime juice concoction where all you could taste was the lime .
Always great service !
In reality ( to maximize potential diners ) they were still taking phone reservations and reallocating tables of those waiting in the lobby .
They do n't seem to place an emphasis on specials or fresh ingredients which to me is necessary for good thai .
I 've been to this restaurant more than a dozen times and when I 'm craving for Pho , Lemon grass chicken or Beef Cube on rice , this is the place to go .
Disappointing food , lousy service .
The waitresses are nice -- also you can just get counter service sit .

By far this is the only chinese desserts place I know in NY or anywhere close in the Northeastern America that serves desserts with frog jelly in a couple of varieties and pig feet ginger simmered in black vinegar .
aspect: pig feet ginger simmered in black vinegar

text: The drinks are always welll made and wine selection is fairly priced .
The service was friendly and the atmosphere was casual .
Interesting other dishes for a change include chicken in curry sauce and salmon caserole .
The porcini mushroom pasta special was tasteless , so was the seafood tagliatelle .
During our meal , the management came over and checked on us and even bought us a round of drinks .
Also , specify if you like your food spicy - its rather bland if you do n't .
I had to ask her three times before she finally came back with the dish Ive requested .

Barbecued codfish was gorgeously moist - as if poached - yet the fabulous texture was let down by curiously bland seasoning - a spice rub might have overwhelmed , however herb mix or other sauce would have done much to enhance .
